topic: AI Governance and Ethics Research

  entities:
    Ruibo Liu|Researcher
    Laura Weidinger|Researcher
    Anka Reuel|Researcher
    Trond Arne Undheim|Researcher

    UK|Location
    Canada|Location
    Japan|Location
    Australia|Location

  proposition: Ruibo Liu and colleagues proposed training socially aligned language models in simulated human society.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Ruibo Liu|RESEARCHES|Language Models
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Language Models|DESCRIBED_BY|socially aligned

  proposition: Laura Weidinger and researchers explored ethical and social risks of harm from language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Laura Weidinger|RESEARCHES|Language Models
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Language Models|ASSOCIATED_WITH|ethical risks
    Language Models|ASSOCIATED_WITH|social risks

  proposition: Anka Reuel and Trond Arne Undheim argue that technical research and talent are needed for effective AI governance.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Anka Reuel|COLLABORATES_WITH|Trond Arne Undheim
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    AI Governance|REQUIRES|technical research
    AI Governance|REQUIRES|talent

  proposition: Hang Li and team investigated bringing generative AI to adaptive learning in education.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Hang Li|RESEARCHES|Generative AI
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative AI|APPLIED_TO|adaptive learning
    Adaptive Learning|DOMAIN|education

  proposition: Yingji Li and researchers conducted a survey on fairness in large language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yingji Li|RESEARCHES|Large Language Models
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Large Language Models|EVALUATED_BY|fairness survey

  proposition: Isabel O Gallegos and colleagues performed a survey on bias and fairness in large language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Isabel O Gallegos|RESEARCHES|Large Language Models
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Large Language Models|EVALUATED_BY|bias survey
    Large Language Models|EVALUATED_BY|fairness survey

  proposition: Multiple government bodies have developed AI governance and ethics principles, including UK, Canada, Japan, and Australia.
    entity-entity relationships:
    UK|DEVELOPS|AI Governance Principles
    Canada|DEVELOPS|AI Governance Principles
    Japan|DEVELOPS|AI Governance Principles
    Australia|DEVELOPS|AI Governance Principles

  proposition: Joseph R Biden issued an executive order on safe, secure, and trustworthy AI development and use.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    AI Development|DESCRIBED_BY|safe
    AI Development|DESCRIBED_BY|secure
    AI Development|DESCRIBED_BY|trustworthy

  proposition: Rishi Bommasani and team developed Foundation Model Transparency Reports and Transparency Index.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Foundation Models|EVALUATED_BY|Transparency Reports
    Foundation Models|EVALUATED_BY|Transparency Index

  proposition: Peter Kieseberg and researchers explored controllable AI as an alternative to trustworthiness in complex AI systems.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Peter Kieseberg|RESEARCHES|Controllable AI
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Controllable AI|ALTERNATIVE_TO|Trustworthy AI Systems

  proposition: Buck Shlegeris and colleagues researched AI control and improving safety despite intentional subversion.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    AI Control|GOAL|improving safety
    AI Control|CHALLENGES|intentional subversion

  proposition: Rafael Rafailov and team investigated direct preference optimization for language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Rafael Rafailov|RESEARCHES|Language Models
    
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Language Models|OPTIMIZATION_METHOD|direct preference optimization
